intro: Elatostema gabonense, commonly known as the Gabonese elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Central and Southern Africa, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. It has a fibrous root system and often forms dense ground cover. Elatostema gabonense is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
